page.title: 04Farming,Animal Sanctuary.
page.content: {Bleakholt Animal Sanctuary}depends entirely on donations and has no other form of income. The general public can become members by paying an annual suhbscription. Functions such as jumble sales and other money_raising events occur throughout the year. During the summer volunteers help exercise the animals. The animals include many breeds of dogs, cats, ponies and donkeys, as well as smaller animals such as ducks, geese and even squirrels which have been given by the National Trust.They do however, refuse to accept Tropical species as they require heated cages and so would be too costly to maintain. The public are free to go to the farm and for a donation can take an animal providing they can offer it a good home.
